column5: For the past few weeks, it's been perch, after perch, after perch..  Finally I managed to ice a decent Simcoe Whitie.  First for the year.  We didn't mark much in the way of white fish schools.  the odd loner cruising through.  Lots of perch.  I decided to take a coffee break.  So I sat my rod down, and poured a cup.  Halfway through my cup of joe, I notice a single whitie on bottom.  Put down the cup down.  Jig jig.... Bang.  Gotta love it.    Here's my rig, with the new Strikemaster..     Here's a shot of last weekend.  My sled hasn't run right since.  Engine compartment is full of snow..    Made for a nice photo though!    It was a cold day on the ice.  But worth it.  Good luck to anyone out there this weekend!
I thought that first pic was from the 80's!!!!!!!!!!!!!
That looks like a good fish their was the coffee frozen before you got back to it 3 minutes later. BRRRR   Art

Is see how you could think that!!  87' Bravo, fuzzy cell phone picture, and what appears to be a dirty stash on my face..   Cold, but not frozen!..  The baileys makes it seem warm, no mater how cold it gets.
Well done.   I have yet to get out yet.
Nice job on the report.  Thanks for sharing, MTBF
Nick really does look like he,s from the 80,s  Nice fish dude.
Technically that's true..  I was born in the 80's..
i thought "snot rocket" was a term devoted to pike... nice whitie though!!!
Congrats on your first NAW Powder overdose on the last pic
Way to go Nick. Is that a Bravo "Trapper". Nice light sled that isn't fast but works hard.

Good eye.  It's actually an bravo Transporter, short track.  I just build a storage box for the back, so it looks like a trapper.  I wish it was a trapper!  Good working sled, until you fill the engine compartment with snow, then.. Not so much..
